Description:
To make sure that products being produced or sold meet the expectations of the consumer. They examine materials to make sure they meet quality expectations and Company plans.Adhere to high standards, and adjust if necessary.Monitor operations to ensure that they meet production standards and consumer expectations.
Recommend adjustments to the assembly
Inspect, test, or measure materials.
Measure products and services accordingly to achieve goal.Skills
Skills:
Knowledge of Industry Standards: A thorough understanding of quality control, health, safety, and environmental regulations and standards relevant to the industry in which they work. This includes knowledge of local, national, and international regulations.
Safety Regulations: Familiarity with safety protocols and the ability to enforce safety measures effectively to prevent accidents and injuries on-site.
Environmental Compliance: Understanding of environmental regulations and the ability to monitor and enforce compliance with regard to waste disposal, pollution prevention, and sustainability practices.
Quality Control: Proficiency in quality control processes, including inspection, testing, and documentation, to ensure products and processes meet established standards.
Risk Assessment: The ability to identify potential risks and hazards on-site and implement preventive measures to mitigate them.
Communication Skills: Effective communication is crucial for conveying safety and quality information to workers, management, and regulatory bodies.
